= Components =

|| *Component Code* || *Component Name* || *Function* || *Comments* ||
|| *BSA.CR* || [BrainComponentCerebellum Cerebellum] || Motor coordination || ||
|| *BSA.RN* || Red Nucleus || Motor coordination || Crawling of babies is controlled by RN ||
|| *BSA.LC* || Locus Coeruleus || Regulate the intensity of responses to salient stimuli || NE Source, enhance signal-to-noise ratio, suppressing irrelevant stimuli (lateral inhibition) ||
|| *BSA.RP* || Raphe Nucleus || Regulate moods, temper anxiety, and relieve depression || Releases 5HT (serotonin) hormone (happiness) ||
|| *BSA.PAG* || Periaqueductal Gray Matter || Descending modulation of pain and in defensive behaviour || ||
|| *BSA.VTA* || Ventral Tegmental Area || Respond to novel stimuli, unexpected rewards, and reward predictive sensory cues || ||
|| *BSA.ITP* || Interpeduncular Nucleus || Respond to various kinds of stress || ||
|| *BSA.CNF* || Cuneiform Nucleus || Passive coping strategy to novel, painful or threatening stimuli || ||
|| *BSA.LTG* || Laterodorsal Tegmental Nucleus || Modulating sustained attention or in mediating alerting responses || ||
|| *BSA.RF.MES* || Mesencephalic Reticular Formation || Saccades, fixation, gaze holding and vergence || Spaceâ€“time coordinated rapid eye movements ||
|| *BSA.RF.PO* || Pontine Reticular Formation || Maintenance of alertness and the conscious state || pedunculopontine nucleus? ||
|| *BSA.RF.MED* || Medullary Reticular Formation || Somatic motor control || ||

= Connections =

  * SCA -> (spinoreticulat tract) -> BSA.RF -> (reticulospinal tract) -> SCA
  * BGA -> BSA.CR -> BSA.RN -> (rubrospinal tract) -> SCA
  * HMA -> (trigeminoreticular tract) -> BSA.CR
